dt: {bc}a crystalline compound NaCl that consists of sodium chloride, is abundant in nature, and is used especially to season or preserve food or in industry
{bc}a substance (such as Glauber's salt) resembling common salt
{bc}a mineral or saline mixture (such as Epsom {a_link|salts}) used as an aperient or cathartic
{bc}any of various compounds that result from replacement of part or all of the acid hydrogen of an acid by a metal or a group acting like a metal {bc}an ionic crystalline compound

often used in the phrases {it}above the salt{/it} and {it}below the salt{/it} alluding to the former custom of seating persons of higher rank above and those of lower rank below a saltcellar placed in the middle of a long table
{bc}an ingredient that gives savor, piquancy, or zest {bc}{sx|flavor||}

dt.t: a people … full of life, vigor, and the {wi}salt{/wi} of personality

dt: {bc}a dependable steadfast person or group of people
usually used in the phrase {it}salt of the earth{/it}

dt.t: a tale worthy of an old {wi}salt{/wi}

dt: usually used in the phrase {it}worth one's salt{/it}

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}sealt{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}salz{/it} salt, Lithuanian {it}saldus{/it} sweet, Latin {it}sal{/it} salt, Greek {it}hals{/it} salt, sea
shortdef: a crystalline compound NaCl that consists of sodium chloride, is abundant in nature, and is used especially to season or preserve food or in industry —called also common salt
a substance (such as Glauber's salt) resembling common salt
a mineral or saline mixture (such as Epsom salts) used as an aperient or cathartic

dt: {bc}to treat, provide, or season with common salt
{bc}to preserve (food) with salt or in brine
{bc}to give flavor or piquancy to (something, such as a story)
{bc}to enrich (a mine) artificially by secretly placing valuable mineral in some of the working places
{bc}to sprinkle with or as if with a salt

shortdef: to treat, provide, or season with common salt
to preserve (food) with salt or in brine

dt: {bc}a usually colored crystalline compound for perfuming and softening bathwater

{bc}any of various synthetic illicit drugs with stimulant and sometimes hallucinogenic properties that are used (as by being injected or snorted) typically in the form of a white or brown crystalline powder

shortdef: a usually colored crystalline compound for perfuming and softening bathwater

any of various synthetic illicit drugs with stimulant and sometimes hallucinogenic properties that are used (as by being injected or snorted) typically in the form of a white or brown crystalline powder

fl: noun, plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}a bitter colorless or white crystalline salt MgSO{inf}4{/inf}·7H{inf}2{/inf}O that is a hydrated magnesium sulfate with cathartic properties

shortdef: a bitter colorless or white crystalline salt MgSO4·7H2O that is a hydrated magnesium sulfate with cathartic properties

fl: noun, plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}a usually scented aromatic preparation of ammonium carbonate and ammonia water used as a stimulant and restorative

shortdef: a usually scented aromatic preparation of ammonium carbonate and ammonia water used as a stimulant and restorative

dt: {bc}a dry mixture of the principal salts of the gall of the ox used as a liver stimulant and as a laxative

shortdef: a dry mixture of the principal salts of the gall of the ox used as a liver stimulant and as a laxative

dt: {bc}a salt (such as an alum) yielding on hydrolysis two different cations or anions

shortdef: a salt (such as an alum) yielding on hydrolysis two different cations or anions

dt: {bc}a seasoning of ground dried garlic and salt

shortdef: a seasoning of ground dried garlic and salt

dt: {bc}a crystalline salt KNaC{inf}4{/inf}H{inf}4{/inf}O{inf}6{/inf}·4H{inf}2{/inf}O that is a mild purgative

shortdef: a crystalline salt KNaC4H4O6·4H2O that is a mild purgative

dt: {bc}common salt occurring in solid form as a mineral
{bc}salt artificially prepared in large crystals or masses

shortdef: common salt occurring in solid form as a mineral; also : salt artificially prepared in large crystals or masses
